timeline.message:
Add bridge alert examples

Signed-off-by: Stanislav Knot <sknot@redhat.com>

timeline.bodyText: Out of curiosity, how did you come up with the value of 10 (ms I guess?)?
timeline.author: scholzj
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -185,6 +185,46 @@ spec:
       annotations:
         summary: 'All Kafka Bridge containers down or in CrashLookBackOff status'
         description: 'All Kafka Bridge containers have been down or in CrashLookBackOff status for 3 minutes'
+    - alert: AvgProducerLatency
+      expr: strimzi_bridge_kafka_producer_request_latency_avg > 10
+      for: 10s
+      labels:
+        severity: warning
+      annotations:
+        summary: 'Kafka Bridge average consumer fetch latency'
+        description: 'The average fetch latency is {{ $value }} on {{ $labels.clientId }}'
+    - alert: AvgConsumerFetchLatency
+      expr: strimzi_bridge_kafka_consumer_fetch_latency_avg > 10
+      for: 10s
+      labels:
+        severity: warning
+      annotations:
+        summary: 'Kafka Bridge consumer average fetch latency'
+        description: 'The average consumer commit latency is {{ $value }} on {{ $labels.clientId }}'
+    - alert: AvgConsumerCommitLatency
+      expr: strimzi_bridge_kafka_consumer_commit_latency_avg > 10
+      for: 10s
+      labels:
+        severity: warning
+      annotations:
+        summary: 'Kafka Bridge consumer average commit latency'
+        description: 'The average consumer commit latency is {{ $value }} on {{ $labels.clientId }}'

replies.bodyText: As far as I can see they are "seconds" and 10 seconds of latency sound to be too high for an alarm.
replies.author: ppatierno

replies.bodyText: It should be miliseconds. So if we have latency > 10ms for 10s, fire an alert.
replies.author: sknot-rh

replies.bodyText: So have you done any tests to see that the 10ms latency is really something to alert about?
replies.author: scholzj

replies.bodyText: No, I do not know how to simulate latency
replies.author: sknot-rh

replies.bodyText: I guess you should at lest try some performance test and watch what will be the average latency during it to set the alert right.
replies.author: scholzj
